subject: Re: Mac::Carbon Bug
body:
Thanks.
I didn't subscribe to macosx@perl because it said it was for OS 9...

On Apr 30, 2007, at 3:57 PM, Jay Savage wrote:

> On 4/30/07, Tom Allison  wrote:
>> Can anyone provide details on if a workaround exists for the growing
>> lists of defects for Mac::Carbon not being installable?
>>
>> Mac::Carbon
>> 25075
>> 24770
>> 24841
>> File::HomeDir
>> 25075
>>
>>
>> I'm in need of installing DBI on my MacBook.
>> As a general practice I was going to 'install Bundle::CPAN'
>> and then install DBI.
>>
>> Neither of them can be installed.
>> Not happy.
>>
>
> You should probably be asking this on the mac perl list:
> macosx@perl.org. You can subscribe at perl.org.
>
> You should be able, though, to just skip the CPAN upgrade for now. The
> one that comes the default 5.8.6 installation in Tiger should be just
> fine. Just install DBI and worrk about CPAN and Mac::Carbon later.
>
> when you're ready to tackle the Intel issues, head over to macosx@.
>
> HTH,
>
> --jay
> --------------------------------------------------
> This email and attachment(s): [  ] blogable; [ x ] ask first; [  ]
> private and confidential
>
> daggerquill [at] gmail [dot] com
> http://www.tuaw.com  http://www.downloadsquad.com  http:// 
> www.engatiki.org
>
> values of \u03b2 will give rise to dom!


--
